page.title: 06ROSEWARNE E.H.S.
page.content: Peppers are grown in similar ways. Most of the research with flowers is concerned with bulb plants although there are a series of experiments in progress at the moment with varieties of show pinks.The station has a collection of old daffodil varieties and has been breeding early blooms the most recent of which is "Tamara"-a virus-free strain. Much work is also done on lilies, anenomes and narcissi. Since high winds are often a problem in the South-West, much of the work at Rosewarne is concerned with shelter hedges and trees. Many different types are grown and their efficiency is tested constantly.Daily weather records are kept and all research work is published in papers and annuals reviews.The station has regular open days for the public to see the interesting work involved.
